title: Semi-abelian category
summary: In mathematics, specifically in category theory, a semi-abelian category is a pre-abelian category in which the induced morphism f ¯ : coim ⁡ f → im ⁡ f {\displaystyle {\overline {f}}:\operatorname {coim} f\rightarrow \operatorname {im} f} is a bimorphism, i.e., a monomorphism and an epimorphism, for every morphism f {\displaystyle f} .
